name: places/ChIJT-im2oBZwokRjvO02p7MLMk
formattedAddress: 468 W Broadway, New York, NY 10012, USA
adrFormatAddress: 468 W Broadway, New York, NY 10012, USA

originalText.text:
I never felt so beautiful! I recently got married in July 2023, and started my wedding lehenga process in November 2022. I desperately wanted a Falguni Shane Peacock lehenga and was so grateful Ave had this designer at their store!

This was the first lehenga I tried on however I wanted to do my due diligence and went to other shops in the NYC area but ultimately went back back to Ave. I knew I wanted a blush color and the Ave team helped make this happen.

This lehenga originally came in a beige color, however I was able to customize it to the colors in the photo. The Ave team worked with the designer to help advise me in the correct color palette and also helped rush order a second scalloped chunni/dupatta. I chose a foil lehenga and it was extremely light weight!

Unlike a lot of Desi clothing stores, Ave was super friendly and provided helpful service! No pressure to have you buy anything and you were able to try on as many lehengas as you wanted. Service was A+ and the store was tidy, clean and beautiful.

Also! Can I just say how they were perfect with my measurements, like down to the cm. I lost a bit of weight closer to my wedding and they altered it complimentary. It fit me like a glove.

Yes, these pieces are pricey but they are also designer so keep that in mind when you are comparing it to lehengas in other shops. For me, when I was bridal shopping the shopping experience was just as important as the outfit itself. When spending money for your wedding you want to ensure you feel in control and walk out happy. I didn’t feel like I got any kind of decent service when I was looking in Long Island, Queens or Jersey. Thank God for Ave!

originalText.text: One of the few places in the city where you can find truly amazing and authentic outfits from India. They carry some beautiful designers! The associates were super friendly and helpful to me as I am looking for my bridal outfit. They even said they could ship to Spain! It was an amazing experience. The only thing I didn’t love was that they only carry one size (usually model size) for each outfit so if you’re a bit of a bigger person you won’t be able to try much on… but that’s not really in the control of the boutique. Definitely come see this place, they are the best!!!

originalText.text:
It was a wonderful and memorable experience. The service was excellent . The staff was super helpful. They took the time to help us find the perfect outfit and the perfect colour for our special day!
Thank you Ave

Thank you Ave

originalText.text: I ordered my sangeet outfit from here and it was absolutely stunning. I had wanted very specific modification to my lehenga and Ave India made sure that every detail was sorted out according to my wishes!

text.text: I ordered my sangeet outfit from here and it was absolutely stunning. I had wanted very specific modification to my lehenga and Ave India made sure that every detail was sorted out according to my wishes!

originalText.text: Do not trust this store with your bridal needs. I never write reviews, but I had such high hopes for this store and was left so disappointed with my experience. All my other bridal shopping from different stores went seamlessly. At Ave, they were nice initially but did not get my measurements right or communicate the changes to their tailor. Several issues were not written down or addressed and I had to fly back and forth to NYC multiple times in the months before my wedding. The left sleeve of my blouse was so tight that I needed lotion and help from staff to pull it off. This happened on two occasions. The proportions were so wrong. I had to ask the tailor to please measure my arms again so we can resolve this asap. I would have preferred to try it on again in person but I could not fit in another NY trip, so they shipped it to me. It took 1 week to arrive because they used the slowest shipping option. After all the alterations, much of the threadwork and beading of the blouse was damaged, and now I have to find a local garment specialist to repair it in the week before my wedding. I spent over $6,000 on a beautiful designer lengha for my wedding ceremony and was expecting perfection from a store that advertises it's "designer experience". At the minimum I would hope to have my concerns taken seriously. They sent me these earrings in response, which I will be returning. Save yourself the hassle and go to LA at Fashion by Rohini or buy from the designers in India directly.
